message: it is.
but the cross-computer and browser sync when the application is deployed through the UBX.
entity or application variables?
entity vars are specific to the user.
The Personal  Block List app allows to block sites inside google results
and the nice thing is that it keeps the blocks even if I switch to another browser.
I believe the app is using application variables
well, it is using entity variables.
but yes
entity.
app variables are the same for all users.
okay, so if I installed the app through a browser extension, crx, xpi... I couldn't share the "blocks" between the browsers
that was one question, the other one would be: are application variables still unavailable on production system as the wiki says ( http://wiki.kynetx.com/pages/Expressions#Persistent_Variables ) ?
you should be looking at http://docs.kynetx.com And no, they are avaliable on produciton. We need to take down that old wiki. Where did you find links to it?
http://www.google.com/search?q=application+variables+kynetx&hl=en
When using a kynetx app installed as a browser extension "the entity" is effectively tied to a cookie
KBX is powerful magic! Use it wisely :)
2 GB. Use it wisely.
May I also offer the following series of blog post which explore the use of both Entity and Application variables http://edoism.orcutt.org/
Yes, you may. Nice series of posts, btw.
Thank you sir, you are too kind

@loic Brilliant!

@TelegramSam GigaBytes or Megabytes? I've actually been confused about this myself. I was pretty certain that I hear someone say GB, but the docs say MB http://docs.kynetx.com/docs/Persistent_Variables
App and Ent variables are really designed for simple use. We plan on expanding our module library to include simpledb access and other dbs.
Based on my queries it seems that incrementing persistent counters in the postlude are atomic (e.g. app:visitor_count += 1 from 1) http://docs.kynetx.com/docs/Persistent_Variables
nice posts indeed. thank you Ed
No
Sam, GigaBytes or Megabytes? I've actually been confused about this myself. I was pretty certain that I hear someone say GB, but the docs say MB http://docs.kynetx.com/docs/Persistent_Variables
You are correct on both counts. Docs say MB, really is GB.
couchdb?
good to know that. I was about to write a ruleset that streams mp3, now I can add video to it...
atomicity is also quite important because without atoms nothing would exist. ;)
But with the KBX Entity variables are tied to your to kynetx app thru the KBX, which can span multiple browsers on multiple computers.
how much data can I stick in an application variable, do you know ?
there are no "transactions" in krl i supose
Thank you Alex, get some sleep ... you may need it :)
No problem, just enjoy hack'in KRL!
ah that's an interesting topic
However, you can use Persistent Application variables across browser extensions, but keep in mind that the variables are shared across ALL instances, not just for a single user.
At some point over 1 GB you will see performance slow, and be aware that race conditions are not protected, so the larger your structure, the more chance you have of a missed write.
sure, but a hosted couchdb. I'm a mongo-ite myself. (mongonian? mongoid?)
